A Norman Hillfort was sited at the top end of my local High Street, just before AD 1100. This app is a gentle introduction to an understated and some may say even surprisingly well hidden piece of history. 

See if you can gain full marks on my quiz.

The Friends of Bailey Hill meet regularly and are in the process of seeking charitable status to help improve access to this ancient monument whilst enhancing it's value to the community of Mold and environs. As well as the site of the hill fort, there is the Coronation Tree planted in 1902 (for Edward VII) and the Gorsedd stone circle laid in 1922 for the 1923 Eisteddfod (spoken word and music festival). 


Bailey Hill is to be found at the top of Mold High Street in Flintshire, North East Wales. 


You can't miss it.
